pull.title: BIP 0002: Remove transparent background from figure
pull.body:
This is basically the same as https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1184,
but there transparent background hampers reading text much more
than here hampers seeing the node relationships.

events.message:
Remove transparent background from figure

This increases contrast when reading on GitHub, if GitHub is switched
to dark theme.

issue.title: BIP 0174: Remove transparent background from figures
issue.body:
This is basically the same as https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1184
and https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1192. In 1192, node connections
are visible, but with low contrast. In 1184 and in this case, arrows are
barely visible at all.

issue.title: BIP 0144: Remove transparent background from figure
issue.body:
This is basically the same as https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1184,
https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1192,
and https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1193. In 1192, node connections
are visible, but with low contrast. In 1184 and in 1192 and in 1193 and in
this case, there are figure elements, arrows or texts, barely visible at all,
when GitHub is switched to dark theme.

issue.title: BIP 0156: Remove transparent background from figures.

events.body: Behind the text, ok, but not the background itself please.

I would say... something has changed in GitHub dark theme and the contrast is now much better than when this was submitted.

But I still think that is more convenient a white background in the figure than having connection lines be set to some grey finely tuned to not one but two third party presentation styles, GitHub light and GitHub dark.

I get that being able to read this BIP here is no more than a byproduct of reading this at the wiki (or any infrastructure under larger control than this), but still. It could be nice that the picture does not causes problems when viewed from GitHub.
Maybe a white outline between black and transparency? Not sure how to get that kind of rendering tho
Very good idea. I can and will do that.

events.message: Draw the rest of the chart

events.body: The commit message of rev 986e3a0 was wrong, fixed in ccbfa14 and force pushed, contents are the same.
The current PR looks nonsensical to me.
At the very least squash into a single commit, I don't see why this needs 6 separate ones.

On Thu, Dec 16, 2021 at 3:27 AM kallewoof ***@***.***> wrote:

> At the very least squash into a single commit, I don't see why this needs
> 6 separate ones.
>
Specifically wanted to defer squashing until concept feedback.
